pull.title: locking for Misbehave() and other cs_main locking fixes
pull.body: In several places in main.cpp, synchronized data structures are accessed without cs_main being held.

events.message:
lock cs_main for State/Misbehaving

ProcessMessage calls State(...) and Misbehaving(...) without holding the
required lock; add LOCK(cs_main) blocks.

lock cs_main for chainActive

ActivateBestChain uses chainActive after releasing the lock; reorder operations
to move all access to synchronized object into existing LOCK(cs_main) block.

events.body: hmph. peppering cs_main in the middle of functions sounds like a formula for lock inversion.  Perhaps Misbehaving() should get its own lock internally and not depend on cs_main?

A separate nodestate cs is definitely doable; there's a fair amount of code that would need to hold cs_main and nodestate, but no new locks ever need to be acquired within the scope of a cs_nodestate lock. I'll draft a refactor.

rename.to: locking for Misbehave() and other cs_main locking fixes

events.body: I created a separate mutex, cs_misbehavior. cs_misbehavior is only locked either directly inside a cs_main lock or along with no other locks, so there shouldn't be any deadlocks (and DEBUG_LOCKORDER isn't complaining). cs_misbehavior is the sole mutex guarding the nMisbehavior and fShouldBan fields; modifications to the mapBlockSource container are guarded by both cs_main and cs_misbehavior so that either lock suffices to perform lookups safely.
@kazcw I don't see your cs_misbehaviour, but I think the code here is fine as is. We certainly need a separate lock for node states, but I would delay that until the net refactors are done.
utACK 719de56,  and I concur that I do not see `cs_misbehavior`

utACK 719de56
Going to merge this, the nit can be done later.

issue.title: CNodeState encapsulation, lock reduction
issue.body:
I wrote this as a reimplementation for #7942 but forgot to actually push it. The merged version of that PR is, as @gmaxwell brought up, prone to lock inversion. It actually has an inversion of cs_main/cs_filter; the conflicting locks are all taken in the same thread, but it's not good practice.

This uses a new mutex for the two Misbehavior()-related fields of CNodeState, and as an additional lock for mapNodeState. No other locks except addrman's (which is fully encapsulated) are taken while cs_misbehavior is held.

Also, tacked on the fix for the redundant variable from #7942 pointed out by @sipa.

issue.title: Missing cs_main lock in ProcessMessage()
issue.body: ProcessMessage() in net.cpp calls "Misbehaving()", which requires the cs_main lock. However, the lock is not aquired in ProcessMessage.

issue.title: Locking for Misbehave() and other cs_main locking fixes
Backport Bitcoin PR#7942: locking for Misbehave() and other cs_main locking fixes
issue.body:
This is backport of Bitcoin PR bitcoin/bitcoin#7942.

The original PR description follows.
---
In several places in main.cpp, synchronized data structures are accessed without cs_main being held.

issue.title: Add -stopatheight for benchmarking + bugfixes
issue.body:
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7821 - init: allow shutdown during 'Activating best chain...

719de56 from https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7942
The other commit (efb54ba) is not needed because nodestate has its own lock. nPreferredDownload was unprotected though, so I added a commit to make it atomic.

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8063 - Acquire lock to check for genesis block
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10290 - Add -stopatheight for benchmarking
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10305 - Fix potential NPD introduced in b297426c
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10569 - Fix stopatheight

issue.title: Bitcoin 0.13 locking PRs
issue.body:
These are locking changes from upstream (bitcoin core) release 0.13, oldest to newest (when they were merged to the master branch).
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7846
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7913
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8016
  - second commit only; first commit, test changes, are already done
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7942

This PR does not include:
 - https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8244 https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/27f8126ff37ec590c266adc6228d216857606536
   -  zcash requires locking `cs_main` in this instance (`getrawmempool()` calls `mempoolToJSON()`, which calls `chainActive.Height()`).
